Date: December 15, 2024

ITC Foods is focusing on expanding its market presence in northern and western India while transitioning towards branded products. The company is also exploring potential acquisitions to enhance its brand portfolio.

  • ITC Foods plans to increase its market share in the fast-moving consumer goods (FMCG) sector, specifically in staples, snacks, health foods, dairy, and beverages.

"Stay ahead of the curve with the latest insights from the corporate world through our company news coverage," highlighting the dynamic landscape of business and market shifts.

MobiKwik IPO: Know Latest GMP, Allotment, and Listing Dates - News18
summary:
MobiKwik IPO: Know Latest GMP, Allotment, and Listing Dates

Publication Date: December 15, 2024

Source: News18

The much-anticipated initial public offering (IPO) of MobiKwik has concluded with impressive subscription numbers and is set for a strong market debut on December 18.

  • The IPO was open for bidding from December 11 to December 13.
  • The IPO received an overwhelming subscription rate of 125.69 times overall, with retail investors at 141.78 times, NIIs at 114.7 times, and QIBs at 125.82 times.
  • MobiKwik’s unlisted shares are currently trading at Rs 444, which is 59.14% higher than the upper price band of Rs 279.
  • The allotment will be finalised on December 16, with listing on the BSE and NSE scheduled for December 18.
  • The total size of the public issue is Rs 572 crore, consisting entirely of fresh equity shares.
“As of today, MobiKwik’s unlisted shares are trading at Rs 444 per share, which is Rs 165 or 59.14% higher than the upper price band of Rs 279, signaling a strong debut on December 18.”

Founded by Bipin Preet Singh and Upasana Taku, MobiKwik aims to solidify its position in India’s fintech ecosystem with this IPO.

Investors bracing for 24 hours of big decisions from US to Asia and beyond - The Economic Times
summary:
Investors bracing for 24 hours of big decisions from US to Asia and beyond

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] | Source: ET Now

The upcoming 24 hours will be crucial for global investors as major central banks, including the Federal Reserve, will announce key monetary policy decisions, marking the end of a year where inflation has begun to ease.

  • The Federal Reserve is expected to implement a quarter-point rate cut amidst inflation concerns.
  • Central banks in Japan, the UK, and the Nordics will also announce their monetary policy decisions.
  • Data on China’s economic health includes industrial production and retail sales, which will be closely monitored.
  • In Canada, a budget update from Finance Minister Chrystia Freeland is anticipated amidst speculation about the deficit.
  • The Bank of England is expected to maintain cautious monetary policies given ongoing economic concerns.
“Trump has promised a whirlwind of actions that will affect inflation and economic activity, complicating the FOMC’s job.” - David Wilcox, Director of U.S. Economic Research

As central banks around the world prepare for key announcements, the focus will be on how policymakers navigate differing economic risks and the potential for economic shifts in 2025.

Companies News Today Live Updates on December 15, 2024: ‘Cook time 2 min, delivery time 8 min’: Bombay Shaving's CEO Shantanu Deshpande raises concern over food delivery market | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Companies News Today Live Updates on December 15, 2024: ‘Cook time 2 min, delivery time 8 min’: Bombay Shaving's CEO Shantanu Deshpande raises concern over food delivery market

Publication Date: December 15, 2024

Source: LiveMint

Shantanu Deshpande, the CEO of Bombay Shaving Company, expresses serious concerns regarding the health implications associated with the rapid food delivery market in India, addressing issues like preparation times and overall safety.

  • Deshpande highlights that the quick commerce food delivery process is too rapid — 'Cook time 2 min, delivery time 8 min' — raising alarm over health standards.
“The quick pace of food delivery poses health risks and raises questions about safety,” said Shantanu Deshpande.

This commentary underscores the need for a critical examination of the quick commerce industry and its practices, particularly concerning consumer health and safety.

title: ‘Cook time 2 min, delivery time 8 min’: Bombay Shaving's CEO Shantanu Deshpande raises concern over food delivery market | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
‘Cook time 2 min, delivery time 8 min’: Bombay Shaving’s CEO Shantanu Deshpande raises concern over food delivery market

Publication Date: 15 Dec 2024, 03:54 PM IST

Source: Live Mint

Shantanu Deshpande, CEO of Bombay Shaving Company, has expressed serious concerns regarding the food delivery market in India, highlighting issues related to unhealthy eating habits and the implications of rapid food delivery services.

  • Deshpande warns that India's fast growth in food delivery mirrors the unhealthy trends seen in the US and China.
  • He critiques the promotion of cheap, unhealthy food items such as 49 rupee pizzas and 20 rupee energy drinks.
  • The CEO advocates for more palatable food and emphasizes cooking at home as a healthier alternative to ordering food.
  • Deshpande urges regulators to monitor food quality and insists that quick delivery should not compromise health standards.
  • His statements resonate with many social media users who agree with his perspective on food quality and public health.
“The gut is the epicentre of your existence. YOU ARE WHAT YOU EAT.” — Shantanu Deshpande

In conclusion, Deshpande's remarks serve as a crucial reminder about the importance of food quality and health, encouraging individuals to prioritize home-cooked meals over fast food delivery options for better health outcomes.

title: Tata Steel Share Price Target 2024: Company engages with NMDC, OMC for future iron ore supply - BUY, SELL or HOLD? - ET Now
summary:
Tata Steel Share Price Target 2024: Company engages with NMDC, OMC for future iron ore supply - BUY, SELL or HOLD?

Publication Date: Updated Dec 15, 2024 15:05 IST

Source: ET NOW News

Tata Steel is actively negotiating with NMDC and OMC to secure iron ore supplies as part of its strategy to boost steel production capacity in India.

  • Tata Steel operates India's oldest steel plant in Jamshedpur with a capacity of 11 MTPA.
  • The company recently launched India's largest blast furnace in Odisha, raising production capacity to 8 MTPA.
  • Tata Steel has enhanced its production capacity through acquisitions, including Bhusan Steel (5.6 MTPA) and others.
  • The firm aims to expand domestic steel manufacturing capacity to 40 MTPA by 2030.
  • New mines, Kalamang West and Gandalpada, will fulfill 50% of the iron ore needs by 2029.

"The firm produced 38 million tonnes of iron ore in FY24 and expects to produce 41 million tonnes in FY25."

Tata Steel is laying the groundwork for increased production while ensuring raw material security through strategic partnerships and new mining operations.

Indian-origin CEO asks if he should get a green card. Elon Musk answers - India Today
summary:
Indian-origin CEO asks if he should get a green card. Elon Musk answers.

Published On: Dec 15, 2024

Source: India Today

Indian-origin CEO Aravind Srinivas, who has been waiting three years for US citizenship, asked on X whether he should apply for a green card. Elon Musk responded with a simple “Yes,” igniting discussions on the platform.

  • Aravind Srinivas is the CEO of Perplexity AI, a company he founded in 2022.
  • He sought advice on whether to file for a green card due to his lengthy waiting period for citizenship.
  • Musk's reply received significant attention and support from social media users.
  • Days prior, Musk commented on the challenges posed by the US immigration system, highlighting the irony of criminal versus intellectual entry.
  • Srinivas has a strong academic background and experience at leading tech companies like Google and OpenAI.
“The system makes it easier for criminals to enter the country than it does for intellectuals or Nobel Laureates.” - Elon Musk

This interaction underscores ongoing concerns regarding the US immigration process, particularly for talented individuals. Musk's support may amplify discussions around reforming the system to benefit skilled immigrants.

Top 10 Year-End Discounts On 7-Seater SUVs & MPVs - Up To Rs. 6.5 Lakh - GaadiWaadi.com
summary:
Top 10 Year-End Discounts On 7-Seater SUVs & MPVs - Up To Rs. 6.5 Lakh

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Gaadi Waadi

As year-end sales surge, manufacturers are rolling out significant discounts to stimulate buyer interest. Leading the charge are several models boasting impressive savings.

  • MG Gloster (MY2023): Offers a maximum discount of Rs. 6.5 lakh, including direct cash benefits and additional incentives.
  • Skoda Kodiaq (MY2023): Provides Rs. 5.5 lakh in savings through cash, leasing benefits, and maintenance packages.
  • Maruti Invicto Hybrid Petrol (Alpha): Features a discount of Rs. 2.65 lakh, contingent on using in-house financing and scrapping an old vehicle.
  • Jeep Meridian (MY2023 Overland): Offers a discount of Rs. 2.3 lakh, primarily for its premium variant.
  • MG Hector Plus Diesel (Smart): Includes a Rs. 2.2 lakh discount with various benefits.
  • Mahindra Bolero (B6 Opt): Provides Rs. 1.28 lakh in discounts through cash and exchange offers.
  • Mahindra Scorpio Classic (Base): Comes with a Rs. 1.15 lakh discount and free accessories.
  • Toyota Rumion: Offers a discount of Rs. 90,000, particularly for non-Toyota exchanges.
  • Hyundai Alcazar: Total savings of Rs. 60,000 through various bonuses.
  • Maruti XL6 Petrol: Savings of Rs. 55,000 from scrappage deals.
“Overall, these top 10 models present compelling options for year-end car buyers.”

Shoppers are encouraged to take advantage of these limited-time offers while they last, as a variety of premium SUVs and family vehicles are available for diverse preferences and budgets.

Elon Musk kicked from Path of Exile 2 for 'cheating' weeks after becoming Diablo 4's top player - Hindustan Times
summary:
Elon Musk kicked from Path of Exile 2 for 'cheating' weeks after becoming Diablo 4's top player

Publication Date: Dec 15, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Tech billionaire Elon Musk was reportedly kicked from the Path of Exile 2 game server after being accused of cheating, following his recent success in Diablo 4 where he was ranked among the top players.

  • Musk was disconnected from Path of Exile 2 after sharing that he had been accused of cheating.
  • The message he received indicated he was kicked for performing "too many actions too fast."
  • He humorously denied using any cheating software, claiming to just be fast at clicking.
  • Musk had recently been recognized for completing a challenging level in Diablo 4 quickly.
  • He plans to launch an AI-powered game studio through his company, xAI, to improve the gaming industry.
"Wasn’t even using a macro lol,” Musk joked about his alleged rapid actions in the game.

The incident raises questions about fairness in gaming and Musk's unique position as a prominent figure in both technology and gaming communities.

Last Chance To Buy Rs 50 Lakh SUV At Price Of Tata Nexon! - MotorOctane
summary:
Last Chance To Buy Rs 50 Lakh SUV At Price Of Tata Nexon!

Publication Date: [Insert Date] | Source: MotorOctane

Car buyers now have the opportunity to own a luxury SUV at an affordable price similar to that of a Tata Nexon, particularly highlighting the used Mercedes Benz GLA as an excellent option.

  • The used Mercedes Benz GLA is a luxury SUV available in the Indian market for approximately Rs 16.45 lakh.
  • It features a premium interior, muscular design, and various advanced features such as a panoramic sunroof and a Harman Kardon sound system.
  • Available engine options include a 2.0-litre petrol engine generating 181 bhp and a 2.2-litre diesel engine producing 135 bhp, both matched to a 7-speed DCT gearbox.
  • The GLA stands as a suitable alternative for those considering a Tata Nexon without sacrificing luxury.
"The used Mercedes Benz GLA will be a better and a feature-loaded option you could consider to buy instead of Tata Nexon."

When purchasing from the used car market, buyers are advised to thoroughly inspect vehicles for any damages or issues.

Masterstroke by Infosys as it acquires minority stake in this healthcare deep-tech firm, invests Rs… - India.com
summary:
Masterstroke by Infosys as it acquires minority stake in this healthcare deep-tech firm, invests Rs…

Publication Date: December 13, 2024

Source: India.com

Indian multinational technology company Infosys has announced an investment of Rs 8 crore (approximately USD 1.0 million) in the healthcare startup 4baseCare, aimed at enhancing its capabilities in precision oncology.

  • Infosys invests Rs 8 crore in 4baseCare through its Innovation Fund.
  • The investment aims to improve cancer diagnosis and treatment using AI and analytics.
  • 4baseCare focuses on personalized cancer therapies with a technology-driven approach.
  • Infosys holds a minority stake of up to 20% in 4baseCare.
  • This partnership marks a strategic move to collaborate with AI and DeepTech startups.
“4baseCare provides unique precision oncology solutions leveraging diverse genomic and clinical data,” Infosys stated in its regulatory filing.

The collaboration between Infosys and 4baseCare highlights a commitment to innovation in healthcare, particularly in developing advanced solutions for cancer treatment.
